title: How to Pasteurize Eggs
description:
This quick video will give you some tips on #howto pasteurize eggs!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Pasteurize-Eggs

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you want to pasteurize your own eggs set a bowl of fresh eggs on your counter for 15 to 20 minutes to bring them to room temperature transfer the eggs to a saucepan of water and clip an instant-read thermometer to the side of the pan heat the water on the stove over medium heat until it reaches 140 degrees Fahrenheit 60 degrees Celsius maintain this temperature for three to five minutes remove the eggs from the water using a slotted spoon and rinse them under cold water until they cool to room temperatureif you want to pasteurize your own eggs set a bowl of fresh eggs on your counter for 15 to 20 minutes to bring them to room temperature transfer the eggs to a saucepan of water and clip an instant-read thermometer to the side of the pan heat the water on the stove over medium heat until it reaches 140 degrees Fahrenheit 60 degrees Celsius maintain this temperature for three to five minutes remove the eggs from the water using a slotted spoon and rinse them under cold water until they cool to room temperature

title: How to Peel a Banana
description:
Learn how to peel a banana with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Peel-a-Banana

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if the traditional way of peeling a banana leaves you with a mushy top try the monkey magic or upside down method which starts with holding the banana with the stem pointing downwards gently pinch or push the tip to tear the skin you can also use your nail to puncture the peel next peel downward toward the stem and enjoy if you have a knife handy you can also cut the banana from the tip to the handle and again halfway down the middle horizontally take the skin off the pieces and you have a peeled and quarter treatif the traditional way of peeling a banana leaves you with a mushy top try the monkey magic or upside down method which starts with holding the banana with the stem pointing downwards gently pinch or push the tip to tear the skin you can also use your nail to puncture the peel next peel downward toward the stem and enjoy if you have a knife handy you can also cut the banana from the tip to the handle and again halfway down the middle horizontally take the skin off the pieces and you have a peeled and quarter treat

title: Quick Tips: Peeling Garlic in Seconds | One Pot Chef
description:
Peel an entire head of garlic in just seconds using this simple method. It's almost magical! Never waste time on individually peeling each clove of garlic ever again :)

ONE POT CHEF COOKBOOKS ON iTUNES BOOKSTORE:

subtitles: peeling a whole bulb of garlic can be a real pain sometimes there's so much skin and fiddly mess and it's messy this is the very easy and simple way of doing it first turn it over and then just press down on a shopping ball like so and all the clothes will be separate lays it all into a large memory ball place another bowl on top now here's the fun bit basically we're just going to give this a real good shake for about 10 seconds remove the bowl and inside you will see our garlic cloves have peeled almost by magic there's no skin on them they're perfect and ready to use whether you're going to chop them or dice them or mince them or however you're going to use them perfectpeeling a whole bulb of garlic can be a real pain sometimes there's so much skin and fiddly mess and it's messy this is the very easy and simple way of doing it first turn it over and then just press down on a shopping ball like so and all the clothes will be separate lays it all into a large memory ball place another bowl on top now here's the fun bit basically we're just going to give this a real good shake for about 10 seconds remove the bowl and inside you will see our garlic cloves have peeled almost by magic there's no skin on them they're perfect and ready to use whether you're going to chop them or dice them or mince them or however you're going to use them perfect

title: How to Poach an Egg
description:
Learn How to Poach an Egg with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Poach-an-Egg

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to poach an egg first crack an egg into a small bowl make sure the eggs you're using are as fresh as possible then fill a pot with enough water to cover the egg completely and add a splash of vinegar which will help the egg keep its shape while it's cooking bring the water to a simmer and carefully pour the egg into the water let it cook for three to four minutes or until the egg white is completely set finally use a slotted spoon to transfer the egg to a plate and enjoy if you're poaching more than one egg at a time pour each egg into the same pot of simmering water cook them for two minutes then turn off the heat and let them cook for a few more minutes until the egg whites are set once the egg whites are set transfer the eggs to a plate with a slotted spoon and enjoyto poach an egg first crack an egg into a small bowl make sure the eggs you're using are as fresh as possible then fill a pot with enough water to cover the egg completely and add a splash of vinegar which will help the egg keep its shape while it's cooking bring the water to a simmer and carefully pour the egg into the water let it cook for three to four minutes or until the egg white is completely set finally use a slotted spoon to transfer the egg to a plate and enjoy if you're poaching more than one egg at a time pour each egg into the same pot of simmering water cook them for two minutes then turn off the heat and let them cook for a few more minutes until the egg whites are set once the egg whites are set transfer the eggs to a plate with a slotted spoon and enjoy

title: How to Poach Fish in Milk
description:
Learn how to poach fish in milk with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Poach-Fish-in-Milk

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to poach fish and milk using an oven start by preheating your oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit next pour two cups of whole milk and a pinch of salt in a shallow dish and set two skinless fillets of fish into the baking dish so the milk comes halfway up the sides of the fish then place a dish in the oven and bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until it easily flakes with a fork you can either serve your fish directly from the oven or give it a golden color by broiling it for the last few minutes to learn how to poach fish and milk in the microwave keep readingto poach fish and milk using an oven start by preheating your oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit next pour two cups of whole milk and a pinch of salt in a shallow dish and set two skinless fillets of fish into the baking dish so the milk comes halfway up the sides of the fish then place a dish in the oven and bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until it easily flakes with a fork you can either serve your fish directly from the oven or give it a golden color by broiling it for the last few minutes to learn how to poach fish and milk in the microwave keep reading

title: How to Prepare and Cook Salmon
description:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you want to prepare and cook salmon remove the skin if you prefer not to eat it and use your fingers to pull out any bones sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the salmon along with any other seasonings you prefer like parsley dill lemon or butter you can poach salmon in boiling water cook it on the grill bake it in the oven or broil it in a pan whichever method you choose cook the salmon until it is opaque and flaky and serve it while it's still hotif you want to prepare and cook salmon remove the skin if you prefer not to eat it and use your fingers to pull out any bones sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the salmon along with any other seasonings you prefer like parsley dill lemon or butter you can poach salmon in boiling water cook it on the grill bake it in the oven or broil it in a pan whichever method you choose cook the salmon until it is opaque and flaky and serve it while it's still hot

title: How to Prepare Frozen Spinach
description:
Learn how to prepare frozen spinach with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-Frozen-Spinach

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to prepare frozen spinach on the stove place a large frying pan over low or medium-low heat once the pan has warmed up add the frozen spinach to the pan stir the block of frozen spinach around the pan until it becomes tender then use your cooking utensil to break down the block into smaller chunks as the spinach warms up continue breaking it apart to help it reheat faster pour the reheated spinach into a colander and use a large spoon to press out as much of the liquid as possibleto prepare frozen spinach on the stove place a large frying pan over low or medium-low heat once the pan has warmed up add the frozen spinach to the pan stir the block of frozen spinach around the pan until it becomes tender then use your cooking utensil to break down the block into smaller chunks as the spinach warms up continue breaking it apart to help it reheat faster pour the reheated spinach into a colander and use a large spoon to press out as much of the liquid as possible

subtitles: to prepare quinoa start by adding two parts water and one part quinoa to a large pan then bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat once it starts boiling cover the pan and turn the heat down to low let the quinoa simmer for 15 minutes or until the grains become translucent then take them off the heat and let them stand for five minutes before servingto prepare quinoa start by adding two parts water and one part quinoa to a large pan then bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat once it starts boiling cover the pan and turn the heat down to low let the quinoa simmer for 15 minutes or until the grains become translucent then take them off the heat and let them stand for five minutes before serving

subtitles: to preserve fruit by freezing it start with fruit that is ripe and flavorful use a knife to remove the peels seeds and pits if there are any lay the fruit on a baking sheet in an even layer so that no fruit is overlapping freeze the tray of fruit for one hour and transfer the fruit to freezer bags label the bags with the type of fruit you used and the date and store the bag in the freezer for six to nine months youto preserve fruit by freezing it start with fruit that is ripe and flavorful use a knife to remove the peels seeds and pits if there are any lay the fruit on a baking sheet in an even layer so that no fruit is overlapping freeze the tray of fruit for one hour and transfer the fruit to freezer bags label the bags with the type of fruit you used and the date and store the bag in the freezer for six to nine months you

title: How to Preserve Lemon Juice
description:
Learn How to Preserve Lemon Juice with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Lemon-Juice

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to preserve lemon juice by freezing it start by pouring fresh-squeezed lemon juice into each compartment of an ice cube tray then place the trays in the freezer after one to two hours take the trays out of the freezer and remove the cubes from them to tell if the cubes are done test to see if they are solid but don't expect them to be as hard as regular ice cubes finally transfer the frozen juice cubes to a resealable plastic freezer bag and store the lemon juice in the freezer for several monthsto preserve lemon juice by freezing it start by pouring fresh-squeezed lemon juice into each compartment of an ice cube tray then place the trays in the freezer after one to two hours take the trays out of the freezer and remove the cubes from them to tell if the cubes are done test to see if they are solid but don't expect them to be as hard as regular ice cubes finally transfer the frozen juice cubes to a resealable plastic freezer bag and store the lemon juice in the freezer for several months

title: How to Preserve Peppers
description:
Learn how to preserve peppers with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Peppers

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you want to preserve fresh peppers to use later wash the peppers and cut them in half then scoop out the seeds and the white membrane inside if the peppers are spicy you might want to wear rubber gloves to protect your hands spread the peppers in a single layer on a baking sheet making sure none of the pieces overlap put the tray in the freezer and check them every 20 minutes or so until the peppers are firm then transfer the peppers to an airtight freezer safe container and return them to the freezer where they'll stay good for eight to nine monthsif you want to preserve fresh peppers to use later wash the peppers and cut them in half then scoop out the seeds and the white membrane inside if the peppers are spicy you might want to wear rubber gloves to protect your hands spread the peppers in a single layer on a baking sheet making sure none of the pieces overlap put the tray in the freezer and check them every 20 minutes or so until the peppers are firm then transfer the peppers to an airtight freezer safe container and return them to the freezer where they'll stay good for eight to nine months

title: How to Reheat a Rotisserie Chicken
description:
Watch and learn how to reheat a rotisserie chicken! First, remove it from the packaging and decide if you want to heat it in the oven, stovetop, or microwave. Warm the meat until it reaches 165 °F (74 °C) and serve the hot chicken with your favorite sides. Read more on wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Reheat-a-Rotisserie-Chicken

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to reheat a rotisserie chicken in the oven first preheat your oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit 177 degrees celsius set the chicken in an oven safe dish and cover it with aluminum foil roast the chicken for 25 minutes then remove the foil and let the chicken bake for an additional 5 minutes so the skin is crispy to reheat a rotisserie chicken on the stovetop first cut the chicken into bite-size pieces heat 2 teaspoons 10 milliliters of vegetable oil in a wide saucepan over medium-high heat let the oil heat for 5 minutes then add the chicken to the pan let the chicken cook for 8 minutes stirring it regularly to microwave rotisserie chicken first shred the chicken into small pieces and place them in a microwave-safe bowl microwave the chicken for three minutes then check the temperature with a meat thermometer the chicken is ready once the internal temperature is 165 degrees fahrenheit 74 degrees celsiusto reheat a rotisserie chicken in the oven first preheat your oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit 177 degrees celsius set the chicken in an oven safe dish and cover it with aluminum foil roast the chicken for 25 minutes then remove the foil and let the chicken bake for an additional 5 minutes so the skin is crispy to reheat a rotisserie chicken on the stovetop first cut the chicken into bite-size pieces heat 2 teaspoons 10 milliliters of vegetable oil in a wide saucepan over medium-high heat let the oil heat for 5 minutes then add the chicken to the pan let the chicken cook for 8 minutes stirring it regularly to microwave rotisserie chicken first shred the chicken into small pieces and place them in a microwave-safe bowl microwave the chicken for three minutes then check the temperature with a meat thermometer the chicken is ready once the internal temperature is 165 degrees fahrenheit 74 degrees celsius to reheat a rotisserie chicken in the oven first preheat your oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit 177 degrees celsius set the chicken in an oven safe dish and cover it with aluminum foil roast the chicken for 25 minutes then remove the foil and let the chicken bake for an additional 5 minutes so the skin is crispy to reheat a rotisserie chicken on the stovetop first cut the chicken into bite-size pieces heat 2 teaspoons 10 milliliters of vegetable oil in a wide saucepan over medium-high heat let the oil heat for 5 minutes then add the chicken to the pan let the chicken cook for 8 minutes stirring it regularly to microwave rotisserie chicken first shred the chicken into small pieces and place them in a microwave-safe bowl microwave the chicken for three minutes then check the temperature with a meat thermometer the chicken is ready once the internal temperature is 165 degrees fahrenheit 74 degrees celsius

title: How to Ripen a Cantaloupe
description:
Learn How to Ripen a Cantaloupe with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Ripen-a-Cantaloupe

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to quickly ripen a cantaloupe place it in a large brown paper bag with a ripe apple or banana roll the top of the paper bag to close it leave the bag out at room temperature for a few days checking periodically to test the ripeness to tell if your cantaloupe is ready to eat gently press on the blossom end of the melon which is the end without any stem remnants if it yields just slightly it's ready to eat you can also sniff the blossom end to see if it smells sweet and fruity if it does it's ready to be eatento quickly ripen a cantaloupe place it in a large brown paper bag with a ripe apple or banana roll the top of the paper bag to close it leave the bag out at room temperature for a few days checking periodically to test the ripeness to tell if your cantaloupe is ready to eat gently press on the blossom end of the melon which is the end without any stem remnants if it yields just slightly it's ready to eat you can also sniff the blossom end to see if it smells sweet and fruity if it does it's ready to be eaten
